titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Island, New York census transcriptions ARC.194
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T10:53-0500

did.unittitle: Long Island, New York census transcriptions
did.abstract: The collection consists of two bound notebooks containing handwritten transcriptions of data from the New York State censuses of 1855 and 1865. The notebooks list the names of families that resided in the Long Island towns of Bridge Hampton, East Hampton, and South Hampton, including the first names and ages of the members of each family at the time that the census was recorded. The notebooks do not list the addresses at which these families lived. The transcriber of this data is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Island, New York census transcriptions, ARC.194, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition are unknown. The transriptions were formally accessioned as separate items in 1973.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
